p: Prevention and control: Rabies control has been mainly afforded through the vaccination of wild and domestic susceptible animal species [ 77]. Vaccination is recommended in endemic areas. Several inactivated adjuvant vaccines are commercialized in Europe and can be used in domestic mammals (see Table 2 for the list). Rabies vaccination intervals >1 year may be appropriate for previously vaccinated horses, but not in primed horses vaccinated only once [ 78].
